Asphalt Shingles Asphalt shingles are one of the most popular roofing materials in the United States. They are affordable, easy to install, and come in a variety of colors and styles. Asphalt shingles are made from a base of either organic felt or fiberglass, with granules on top that protect against UV rays, water, and other elements. Advantages: Affordable Easy to install Low maintenance Wide variety of colors and styles Good durability Disadvantages: Not as environmentally friendly as other options May not be suitable for high wind areas Can crack or warp in extreme temperatures Metal Roofing Metal roofing is becoming increasingly popular due to its durability and energy efficiency. It is made from materials such as aluminum, steel, copper, or zinc, and can be installed in various styles, including standing seam, metal tiles, and metal shingles. Tile Roofing Tile roofing is a popular choice in warmer climates, such as the Southwest and Florida. It is made from materials such as clay or concrete and can be installed in various styles, including Spanish, Mediterranean, and Mission. Advantages: Long lifespan (up to 50 years or more) Energy efficient Fire resistant Low maintenance Adds curb appeal and value to the home Flat Roofing Flat roofing is commonly used for commercial buildings, but can also be used for residential properties with flat or low-sloping roofs. It is typically made from materials such as EPDM, TPO, or modified bitumen.
